p: 32. We cannot just “look” at being but must wrest it from things. We encounter being as a phenomenon by wresting it from things. We need a proper method for three things: for the starting point of our analysis, for getting access to the phenomenon, and for piercing through the cover-ups. The “originary,” “intuitive” grasping and explaining of phenomena that we are proposing has nothing to do with the naïveté of an accidental, unmediated, unreflective “just looking” at things.
